pageContext.claim: “How these caravans were formed, you'll have to figure that out. But they overplayed their hand too, assuming they had something to do with it but it was very well organized, amazingly, in Honduras and the different places very well.”
pageContext.analysis: The Honduran president blamed the political opposition for ginning up the caravan as an effort to embarrass his government, but The Washington Post interviewed several people who were self-motivated to join the caravan: "Although the caravan’s origin story remains somewhat opaque, the answer from many migrants here is that they had wanted to leave for months or years, and then — in a Facebook post, on a television program, in a WhatsApp group — they saw an image of the growing group and decided." There is also no evidence to support claims that Venezuela or Cuba funded the caravan.
